page.title: 15FOLKLORE: QUINTON
page.content: Although not in this block,{Meon {Hill does exert considerable influence over the village. Many villagers use the hill for exercise, and some visitors even hang glide from the top. One villager is reputed to have been murdered on the hill in 1945 in a ritual killing. The murder was not solved. Local legend has it that elements of the supernatural are still active on the hill. Traditionally,the village celebrates {May Day, }although this is currently centred around the school. The{Harvest Festival}brings most of the village to the church and includes a harvest supper, which leads to a donation to the starving of the world.
